notes:
### Hover over the item icons below (not hyperlinks) to read additional information!

Always buy  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) and  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) 
Extra HP allows you to earn more money

In the first two rounds, your job is to simply survive and deal damage, getting assists and eliminations for participating in the fight. If you take a lot of risks to get solo kills without having extra hp and die, you will not only spend more time running from the respawn to the action (and therefore earn less), you will also give money to your opponents.

The exception would be if you have a pocket Mercy. Not some random guy on your team, but a person who will definitely boost your damage. The bonus from Mercy is multiplicative, and together with 10% AP you will deal up to 165.9 damage from a rocket explosion versus 150.8 without an AP item. Without Mercy, who buffs your bullets, not only 15 damage, but even 30 damage is not worth neglecting survival, but with a constant damage boost, it becomes the difference between "target is killed" and "target goes around the corner and they get healed."

If you want to understand exactly how the Helix Rockets work, and how Powers works with them, then read my post:
https://www.reddit.com/r/Overwatch/comments/1kj4yp9/soldier_76s_rockets_in_stadium_what_you_need_to/

round_upgrades.notes: Without any items, you can deal 251 damage with a direct hit from a rocket and 5 bullets. With +5% weapon power and +10% ability power items, you can kill a 250 HP target with a direct hit from a rocket and 4 bullets. Is -1 bullet worth 25 of your armor when you don't have pocket Mercy?

The reason Soldier has 19 damage per bullet instead of 19.5+ is because 25 armor is enough to reduce the damage of his first three bullets to 12. +5% WP gives Soldier +7 damage with his third bullet against a hero who has bought 25 armor. But since the rockets exploding under the enemy's feet only deal 127 damage at +10% AP, you'll have to shoot for too long before that +7 damage from the third bullet will lead to anything.
Shields on top of armor will not work as armor! Armor will only start reducing damage when everything on top of it (shields and overhealth) is gone.
If you play with Mercy, then take both +5% WP and +10% AP, so that you can kill enemies with 300 HP, 50 of which is armor, with one Helix and 5-6 bullets after.

notes:
If you have a lot of money, you can get [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) for an extra 10% ability power. 

Also note that I'm not selling survival items because you won't have enough rocket damage until round 3 for the extra 10% ability power to matter.

But if you play with pocket Mercy, you can take a risk if you are just a little short of another +10% AP item. This will add 6 to 13 damage to your rockets under the blue beam, depending on whether you hit direct or somewhere nearby. Whether it is worth it or not - decide for yourself.

The third option is if you get a map with good high grounds, then you can take  [Bomb Diffusal Boots](item_c555901e-1b69-4040-8420-ee81cbaf6d90) because a strong position will be better than a small bonus to damage or survival.

round_upgrades.notes: +30% AP will give you up to 150.8 damage from rocket explosions and 202.8 from a direct hit. +40% AP will give 162.4 and 218.4. Now add Mercy's boost to this (multiply by 1.3) and it will become clear why such a Soldier can already start to dominate in the second round.

Genji, Reaper, Mei, Queen, Lucio, Moira - all of these heroes can be a big problem for Soldier in the early game because he has no escape. This item gives both escape and vertical mobility. Sometimes this item means the difference between "can't play" and "contributing a little and making money".

5% WP can be surprisingly useful against armor, but only when the target has at least 100 of it and you're ready to fire a lot of bullets. 100 armor can be removed with 9 Soldier bullets, which will deal 108 damage (12x9). But with +5% WP the damage will be 123.5 (12.95 x 8 = 103, after which the armor stops working and the ninth bullet deals 19.95). However, in this build, even 100 armor on squishies is not important, because you have two sources of large portions of damage: Helix and MotK
A small boost to survivability will be more important than weapon power percentages or attack speed

If you have 350 HP in 2nd round then you will die only because of your mistakes. This option is good when the team is strong and you can simply help with your damage and earn money for participation. I would call this the greediest and safest option.

It's very rare when I play with a pocket Mercy that I'll be able to save up enough for two +10% AP blue items, one +20% item, and one +10% green item by round 2. But when that happens, I almost always take them at the expense of survivability so I can continue snowballing. Keep in mind that Mercy often provides more value to the team when she revives someone and activates Valkyrie, so your goal is simply to not die in bad spots and maximize your damage advantage.
Shields on top of armor will not work as armor! Armor will only start reducing damage when everything on top of it (shields and overhealth) is gone.

notes:
The idea behind  [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) is that you can use Biotic Field or Helix Rockets early, before a fight, and get bonus damage to your next bullet hit on an enemy. This bonus will not expire over time if you do not shoot anyone and it scales with ability power. 

So with the first 2-3 bullets you can deal damage like with 5-6. Right after the first shots you fire Helix, and the bonus from Mark of the Kitsune activates again for the next hit if you need to finish off a target. That's why you don't need weapon damage or attack speed, just ability power.

This item create a turning point: now your build is online and you don't need survival or weapon damage because you will kill others with ability damage faster than they will kill you. You should only look for an opportunity for an off-angle and combo, and run to safety immediately after you finish it. Repeat every 6 seconds. 

Therefore, [Track and Field](item_b3750fe4-e416-42b6-ad9e-fe92c7dcffc5) is taken as a second power: so that you can have a Biotic Field every 6 seconds to start a new cycle, and also to compensate for the drop in survivability.

And this also means that it's time for you to learn how to do the 3+H+3 combo.

What am I talking about? You'll find out from the description for the next round and the notes on the items.

Now you can confidently play as a flanker, or you can spam combos on the main while behind the tank: it all depends on how comfortable you are finding your opportunities and what map it is.

round_upgrades.notes: At 40% AP, a bullet charged with MotK will deal 54 damage. At 30%, it will be 51.5. The biggest difference will be in the damage from rockets (maximum damage from explosion): 162.4 versus 150.8

Don't pay attention to the lifesteal from abilities. If your rockets deal 200 damage, you will get 20 HP. Not too bad, but you can only launch rockets once every 6 seconds. This item is taken sometimes simply because there are only two +10% items among the blue ones.
An alternative option will be a bit more expensive: instead of [Nano Cola], buy this item and do not sell survival items. 30% AP and 5% WP will be enough for you if you have 50 more HP.
A very interesting option for surviving when you are under a lot of pressure. After Helix, you get 50 HP thanks to Double Helix power. Especially useful against Genji, your strongest counter.

notes:
### Because of the way items work in this build, Soldier has a combo that is meant to optimize your Time To Kill, as well as a benchmark for measuring your burst damage.

**Combo: 3 bullets - Helix - 3 bullets**

The main reason for the combo is to use the bonus damage from MotK twice: before Helix and after. The second reason is to optimize the time to kill. The third reason is that after buying [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) , you get 4 stacks of bonus AP for 3 shots, because the damage from MotK is counted as a separate bullet. Also, since MotK is triggered after the first bullet, it will have +5% AP due to SF. And after Helix, your next shot, the fourth of six, will give you a 5th stack and MotK will deal damage with a +25% bonus.

The last reason for the combo is that if the opponents don't buy survival items and don't increase their HP or armor, then this combo should be enough for you to kill most non-tanks in any round, because your damage will grow faster than the enemy's HP.

Here's another important thing to understand about combos and any other calculations, like "5 bullets and Helix = X damage". These are all ideal cases, benchmarks for your build. In a real game, everything depends on your aim and a little bit on luck. The real TTK will be higher than the theoretical minimum.

You can read more about all this in this post of mine: (in progress)

Further, I will use the notations 3+H+3 for combos and 5+H for the benchmark with five bullets and rockets under your feet. Why five bullets? Because it takes 0.55 seconds to do that, and after you launch Helix, you can't start shooting for another 0.5 seconds. So 5+H represents your realistic burst damage potential, because it's unreasonable to expect you to hit more than 5 bullets in a row and then launch a good Helix in any situation. Especially since your opponents will start reacting to your actions.


#### **Round 4 is extremely important for this build because you can get a serious power spike, while many other builds will only get it on the next round.**
In this round, everything depends on how much money you were able to farm, so those who were patient in the first two rounds will get the reward.

Note that I sold  [Nano Cola](item_79b22609-8046-4a8a-a5a2-bb49cd7e11c6) and replaced it with  [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2)
This is simply an optimization of cost and TTK relative to what your opponents are likely to have. The Nano Cola will give your combo about 10 more damage.

#### Situational option:
**27750**
Buy these instead of SF:  [Battery Pack](item_5ff8a68c-8f07-4531-9050-5cc5d9128b77) , [Energized Bracers](item_f83a1d9e-91f8-4d2c-bd62-c673b8d9fd2e) and  [Biolight Overflow](item_1220eaec-f913-4de2-816c-0dc070b285d0). You will have good unconditional damage with rockets and from  [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) at 65% AP, and your ult will give you and your teammates in a radius of 25 meters 50 overhealth for 3s when activated.  Additional info in the note to Biolight below.

#### When you're short on money:
**22500**
Buy [Energized Bracers](item_f83a1d9e-91f8-4d2c-bd62-c673b8d9fd2e) and [Shady Spectacles](item_ef9bb72f-a56c-4fb6-a552-5abce0b943d7)
The idea is that +5% WP from Custom Stock won't change anything, but an additional 20% lifesteal from Helix's high damage can save your life. 5+H = 306. 3+H+3 = 363

round_upgrades.notes: 318 for 5+H and 377 for 3+H+3. Your ult becomes a strategic resource with which you can win the round. Because of this, you need to choose your positions carefully so that your teammates get overhealth. If you do not have pocket Mercy, then you do not have to shoot 100% of the ult time, and you can save Helix to guarantee a kill of someone with your combo, because without WP and AtkSpd your ult is quite weak by round 4.

notes:
In round 5, all meta builds will get another big power spike. Usually, you just want to get the most ability power for your money, but sometimes it makes sense to think about survival. Judge based on the HP of your opponents: if they go for damage and neglect survival, then you can do the opposite, because you will definitely have enough damage to kill them faster. And vice versa.

Besides the obvious items that give armor or shields, I would highlight  [Iron Lung](item_22867dc9-50a1-4523-a77a-2fd67b487b51) because it fits your playstyle perfectly and works not only as an overhealth, but also as a continuous heal while you are sprinting, which is very helpful for survival. You can assume that your maximum HP will not just be +25%, but +35% or even more if someone is chasing you.

As for the choice of the third Power, everything is obvious: to increase the damage from rockets even more, take  [Cratered](item_5bb876bf-52b5-496c-a9ea-b68e72ed3be1)

Maximizing AP is a priority, because killing with rockets is much more reliable than finishing off targets with rifle shots. This may require you to close the distance to less than 10 meters to better hit with rockets and have a chance at direct hits, so it's worth thinking about survival as well.

That's why, if you have some extra money after buying all the main items, you can sacrifice a small amount of AP to buy either  [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) or  [Iron Lung](item_22867dc9-50a1-4523-a77a-2fd67b487b51) 
But only if your targets don't have a lot of HP! Both items affect your survivability differently and reduce downtime after taking damage, and both items will be in the final version of the build.

And vice versa, if your opponents have a lot of HP, increase your AP to 70 and then the combo will deal 470 damage.

Don't forget about  [Ironclad Exhaust Ports](item_2d085fa5-ace6-4fab-9323-b7a06268bcd0)  this budget option will allow you to get maximum AP for your money without sacrificing survivability.

### What you shouldn't buy:
[Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505)
only 2s of debuff after damage from Rockets is not enough, and if the target gets a lot of healing, it won't help you anyway. It's better to deal more damage at once by increasing AP.
[Liquid Nitrogen](item_a8d99526-05a3-4405-babb-b025479b1b98)
you are not a support, and your rockets are needed to guarantee kills, not to put debuffs on tanks
[Catalytic Crystal](item_3e3f4f77-cdf8-4dda-a5b0-2fb9390aefc4)
your ult is pretty weak, especially in the late game
[Vanadium Injection](item_57953fbc-11ff-4e92-9928-fc59b7be668f)
this item will not work for half of the round, and even when it does, only AP and HP are important to you. In addition, even if your ult is weak, it makes sense to use it at the right moment or against Mercy, Juno or Lucio, because they are the hardest for you to kill.
[Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b)
your targets have less than 30% HP only after the rockets explode, and therefore increasing the damage from your shots will not change much. This item is simply not worth the money in this build.
[Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) 
In theory, this item seems good, but if you try to actually calculate how much damage it will give you with 300-400 HP targets, you will see that it gives two to three times less than MotK even when the target has no armor. The additional damage does not add to the bullet's damage, but is applied separately and is separately reduced by armor, so with armor the item stops working at all against targets with HP less than 500.

#### This is your final form!
For the fourth Power, you have a choice: either  [On Me!](item_cd2a0247-bc79-4f0b-b9ee-d985e3f9a9a7) to increase survivability by raising max HP and getting a good heal per second, or  [Frontliners](item_20863047-0978-4bcd-b75f-499fac432ff0) for situations when you need a big burst of healing and so that you can save not only yourself, but also your teammates.

By default, I took [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) 

But since the fourth Power greatly boosts survivability, you can take something else instead:

[El-sa'ka Supressor](item_b4298dd9-9b93-461f-a2e0-843402667100)
With 30 rounds in the magazine, it is not difficult for the Soldier to occasionally hit the tank in the head and help the team with a debuff if at this time he cannot find a target for himself. And if you have excellent aim, then this will also help in duels, especially against Moira, Cassidy and Reaper.

[Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) 
In theory, can help pop Zarya's bubbles faster and finish her off with direct rockets; not sure, needs more testing

[Endgame Equalizer](item_a2143111-8fa0-4e3b-bbcf-12ed54587234)
**Experimental option!** 
The idea is this: immediately after using Helix, you press the ult and after 1.2 seconds you have Helix again. In this case, it makes sense to take either  [Biolight Overflow](item_1220eaec-f913-4de2-816c-0dc070b285d0) or  [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) along with this item. But keep in mind that this is an all-in option that should allow you to quickly kill 2-3 enemy heroes once per round. Very rarely will overtimes drag out the game so much that you can use two visors.

So the last thing I want to advise is not to forget about the situational item  [Bomb Diffusal Boots](item_c555901e-1b69-4040-8420-ee81cbaf6d90) during the game. The item can be useful at any stage of the game, depending on the map or the composition of the enemy team. Plus, you'll stop dying from your own rockets exploding, isn't that a wonderful item?

Good luck in your games, because you will definitely need luck to get more direct hits with your rockets!
